title: British start-up developing DIY flu tests raises £12.3m to help curb outbreaks
text:
A start-up developing DIY tests for infectious diseases including the flu has raised £12.3m as it lays out plans to curb outbreaks and save the NHS billions.

Sense Biodetection, founded by two brothers in Oxford six years ago and now also in Cambridge, said it had secured £10.5m in a funding round led by local venture firm Cambridge Innovation Capital, and including cash from Abcam chairman Jonathan Milner.

It had also secured a grant of £1.8m from the Government’s research and commercialisation arm Innovate UK.

“We’ve gone to the top tier of investors and sector specialists to raise the funds we need to go through all the formal testing that’s required to get this product to where it could be...
description: A start-up developing DIY tests for infectious diseases including the flu has raised £12.
